Reviews.Title: “Dinner at the Canterbury”
Reviews.Author: jack e
Reviews.Content: Me and three friends had dinner at the Canterbury during Super Bowl week here in Indianapolis. A lovely hotel with a homey atmosphere. The food was very good and the service was excellent. A great place to relax and enjoy a meal with friends. Jack

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel; great location!”
Reviews.Author: ALJARN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a weekend at the Canterbury in downtown Indy. We used valet parking, which was very efficient with great valets. Front desk personnel were courteous and check in was quick. We were in our room in minutes! The hotel itself was a treat-from the piano music playing in the lobby during the afternoon and evening, the beautifully adorned lobby and nicely appointed rooms. Elevators and hallways are small and narrow as expected in an older hotel. We had a king room, can’t remember what floor we were on, but the size was never an issue. There was a large, flat screen in the room, an armoire and a desk. It didn’t feel crowded or cramped. Bed was comfortable; lots of pillows; linens were soft-no issues with any of these. The view from our room wasn’t great, but we didn’t come for the view. Location was perfect. We were able to leave the car in the garage and walk to different restaurants and the mall (connected to the hotel.) Great location for visiting downtown Indy. We didn’t dine in the restaurant or take part in the Sunday morning pastries offered, so I can’t comment on any of those. Personnel were exceptionally professional, courteous and friendly. All seemed to be very proud of the hotel and of Indy as it prepared for the Superbowl. I’d highly recommend the Canterbury to anyone visiting downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique”
Reviews.Author: basil409
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience and rooms, with an ideal location. Try their restaurant as it is one of the best in Indy (according the locals). Lots of charm and period ambiance. I am a very frequent traveler to the point now when I check in to a Mariott, I get confused about what city I'm in. I like boutiques and hip hotels now, if they are reasonable. This is a good find.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful downtown indy”
Reviews.Author: webb1704
Reviews.Content: the hotel was amazing, it looked as better in real life than any of the pictures could do it justice. had a wonderful time with my boyfriend. the pub downstairs on a fri or sat night can be full of the most interesting people. the food was delicious, and the surrounding restuarants were spectacular...could not have asked for anything better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: brian e
Reviews.Content: I travel for business extensively and decided to try something different instead of booking a night at your standard chain hotel.....what a pleasant surprise! Despite some skeptical reviews, I booked a night .....this place is really quite nice! My wife and I pulled in at noon on a Saturday and was quickly greeted by a very hospitable bellman....The front desk was warm and personable and put us in a room immediately...the room was very charming, and yes, like some of the negative reviews, might be considered small but when you realize what kind of Historical Landmark this building is, you can see and feel the immediate charm this hotel bestows. We absolutely took advantage of a very quaint bar area that was actually very intimate; we enjoyed a little bit of a refuge from the bustling and active restaurant scenes and the Circle Center Mall and enjoyed the quiet and romantic bar.....overall, very attentive service and we were extremely satisfied... being righ in the heart of downtown is an added plus.....what a great addition to the City of Indianapolis!

Reviews.Title: “Charming but lacked the service”
Reviews.Author: Chase P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Canterbury Hotel on the first weekend of Superbowl activities. We arrived and the parking lot guy was awesome. We walked into the the hotel and found it to be exactly the hotel we love. We are from New Orleans and actually eek out these type of quaint charming hotels. Now, the bad. We are waiting to check and were not greeted with a bit of an poor attitude. The owner's wife was telling everyone about the concierge floor and inviting guests to come inspect. We love concierge floors and we always pay the extra rate to be on the concierge floor; had we known this was an option we would have doled out the extra 200 or 300 bucks. When we arrived in our updated room, which looked awesome, charming and exactly what we look for in a hotel, the TV did not work. We called down and they said we would have it fixed(no problem there). Since we did not know about concierge except for a guest that told us later that the owner's wife was showing it off to everyone, except us , we went to St Elmo's for dinner. When we arrived back at the room around 10pm we were going to watch TV, relax and order late night room service. Much to our surprise the TV did not work. We called down they moved us to a handicap room where the TV worked, but offered us nothing in return for our inconvenience Not even an offer to help move our bags etc. We would have been happy with literally in small token- ie a 10 dollar bar voucher. The long and the short, the hotel looks great but lacked the hospitality we are accustomed too, when paying for a hotel room. We were impressed that the parking attendant remembered our names. Something that simple goes a long way.

Reviews.Title: “The Canterbury provided us with one of the best stays ever experienced.”
Reviews.Author: Kimmtrentham
Reviews.Content: We found the Canterbury through Expedia and it turned out awesome! The Turner's Restaurant was superb at the hotel. Our room was quaint and provided an excellent, clean stay! Being from Tennessee we love hospitality and we Experienced that as well. The hotel provides an indoor connect to the indoor mall. So so cool. Walking distance to everything! We met the owner, Mr. Turner, as we were leaving and now we see why it's an awesome place! Thank you Canterbury for giving us a great experience for our first trip to downtown Indy! Thanks also to our bellman Reggie!

Reviews.Title: “Hope They Step it UP!!”
Reviews.Author: nicoledt
Reviews.Content: Being that we are from Indianapolis, my husband and I have stayed at the Canterbury many times for a romantic overnight. The location and charm cannot be beat. For our most recent stay, we opted for a suite. Our room was very nice, the view of Lucas Oil was incredible! It was a game night, so seeing all the activity was great. With the Super Bowl a little over a month away, I was interested in seeing if the hotel would meet the expectations of travelers across the country. The bed was comfortable, the shower had good pressure and everything was very clean. What surprised me most was that there were no actual glasses in the room. Just 2 plastic wrapped cups in the sitting room. Petty, yes. But really? We always like to enjoy a glass of wine before dinner and drinking it out of plastic cups felt as if we were staying at a Motel 6. Sure do hope the hotel steps it up a bit! For a room that costs more than $300 a night, we would have liked the option of a glass!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: lauren D
Reviews.Content: I work for a small company and every year for our Christmas Party we take them out for dinner and drinks. Being that we provide drinks we also provide them with hotel accomodations for that evening. The Canterbury Hotel was so easy to work with for our group! They meet all of our needs and then some! I can't say enough wonderful things about their event event staff. Shannon truly helped make our company Christmas party a huge success. If you are in need of group rates/planning for a group event I highly reccomend the Canterbury downtown Indianpolis for your group needs!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but has issues”
Reviews.Author: JanRae22
Reviews.Content: I love staying in boutique hotels instead of large chains and upon arriving was pleased by how beautiful the Canterbury Hotel was. The room was small but I expected that from a historic building so that wasn't an issue. The problems we encountered were: * Extremely uncomfortable pillows which caused me and my husband to lose sleep. I had forgotten to bring my own pillows and regretted it. * Poor service in the hotel restaurant for breakfast. We ate dinner there on Saturday and the service was excellent and our waiter couldn't have been nicer. The next morning we went to the restaurant and stood for awhile without being acknowledged by the one and only server. Finally, another customer came in to use the restroom and said they had stood for quite awhile and just gave up. It was odd because there were four or five employees standing at the check-in desk but only this one person in the restaurant. These two issues changed what would have been a 4 - 5 rating to a 3. It was very disappointing because I'd much prefer to give my business to a smaller hotel such as this one but we won't be returning because of these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Expected much more! Rooms VERY DARK!!”
Reviews.Author: mnnelsons
Reviews.Content: The Canterbury is a beautiful, unique experience in Downtown Indianapolis- Old World Charm. Very close to the Indiana Convention Center and Lucas Oil Stadium. When parking in the parking ramp the cost is $20 per day and you have to walk through the mall with all you personals to get to the Hotel or walk around to front (outside) or of course opt for valet which is hard to find. The rooms are very charming and beautiful with full amoire for our clothing. No coffee pot avaliable, no fridge, no microwave, no iron. Water is left near your ice bucket for an amenity. Would have prefered a coffee pot. The rooms are EXTREMELY DARK, you need to open every single window just to see a little and that is still not much at all, it was very frustrating. The bathroom was leaking around the faucet and soaking all our items on the sink. Doors let in a lot of light from the hallways and not good sound deadening at all in these rooms. Shower was very nice, newer shower head and no water temp fluctuation. One thing that caught our eye several times was that people would order room service and when finished they would put the tray with dirty dishes, coffee etc.. out side of there room in the hallway. These items would sit for at least 2 days (we stayed 4 days) in the hallway and you'd have to walk around or over them and they started to stink, this was very very odd and happened at 2 rooms, not to mention the cocktail glasses that where left for 2 days on a table overlooking the piano in the balcany. Very Odd and untidy!! The staff was pleasant we had no issues with them at all. I may stay again if I need to be that close to the Convention Center, but the Westin and Hyatt appeared to be in much better shape (as we had other business staff staying in those two) Very pricy for what is available and the dark room, dirty halls. It's alright, rating should be a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RJ P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for our anniversary. The staff and service was excellent! Our room had recently been updated and was very nice. The hotel is right in the middle of everything in downtown Indy. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great "boutique" hotel”
Reviews.Author: dangui
Reviews.Content: As far as I'm concerned, you should disregard the less than favorable reviews. I was there on Nov. 13th and found it very agreeable, especially at the price. The 7th floor room was on the cozy side, but that made it even nicer. There were some very minor signs of wear - nothing of any concern. Sometimes I wonder about people who say a scuff on furniture from the vacuum is a problem. Listen, if this hotel was in London or Paris it would be a 4-star + property. Clearly those who get rattled by such little things have never traveled in Europe. The room temperature was just right and the flat-screen TV was huge, at least a 47" model. Linens were clean and crisp. The area for the toilet was a little snug, but how much time is spent there? The location is perfect...countless restaurants within a 5-minute walk, and a big garage right across the street with its direct connection to the sky-walks to the convention center and Circle Center Mall. This place reminds me of hotels in Chicago like the Tremont, Whitehall, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: meandmoo09
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for luxury accommodations this is not it. I understand they are going for a "boutique" old fashioned feel but that should not include peeling wall paper, rusty fixtures and mold on the tiles in the bathroom. ( the latter has not been updated since the 70's maybe). And that's just the bathroom. The bed was uncomfortable at best, pillows were awful and obviously not changed out in years which was unsettling, and the linens were sub-par. AAA gave this a 4 diamond rating and it is listed under 4-5 star hotels, I disagree based on the accommodations. The one positive is the staff. That is what changed my rating from poor to average. The staff are efficient and friendly, and more than willing to share knowledge of Indianapolis , where to eat, things to do ect. Location is also wonderful. However, if you are looking for a 5 star hotel, this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AJMF
Reviews.Content: The following is my original review of our stay, and I stand by my remarks as the true respresentation of our stay. However, I will say that the management of the Canterbury Hotel has been very responsive after hearing my concerns. I would have preferred that employees at the time had felt empowered to make decisions to correct issues and deal with problems; but, that said, the Manager and General Manager have made considerable concessions to us, and to my son and his bride, in the interest of service recovery, for which I thank them. _______ We were looking forward to this stay, as part of my son's large wedding party. However, the customer service was poor for a place of this caliber (and price!) and considering we had filled 29 of their 99 rooms! Aside from poor customer attention, the facility itself is lacking and the rooms are not up to the expected standard. Some examples of the lack of meaningful customer service: - No valet was available to unload our vehicle and take our belongings to the room, so I schlepped everything up myself. I even passed staff members on my journey and was not offered help - Night staff was lackadaisical, with one staff member rude to the point of being surly; he couldn't be bothered with requests – he was too busy surfing the web on the computer in an alcove by the desk. The night manager left my son and his new bride in their full wedding regalia sitting on the floor for 2 hours at 5 AM when the door to their penthouse suite wouldn't open! - Room service staff was unhelpful and generally rude - We requested an iron be sent to our room; an hour later we went down to the desk to fetch one. The facility itself is not up to par, either, although the lobby area and Tucker’s bars are both very nice. The rooms are tiny, dark and HOT! (Our room was so dark -- bulbs that were of low wattage or missing -- that we had to iron in the hallway.) The outlet in the bathroom didn't work. Our daughter's room had no working light in the bathroom at all; she and her husband had to insist on a room change several hours into their stay. Fixtures throughout looked worn. The keycards routinely malfunctioned, necessitating trips up and down to the desk. And the pièce de résistance -- there was roach crawling on the floor. All in all, this was NOT the stay we’d expected or hoped for at a "boutique hotel"!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Snowqueen200
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first trip to Indianapolis. We stayed at the Canterbury for 2 nights. Location, Location, Location is all I have to say about this hotel! Very easy walk to just about everything! The hotel is showing some wear and tear but my room (just a standard Queen) was clean and in decent shape. The only complant is about the breakfast. Either more workers are needed or they should do away with the "complementary" buffet. The one woman worker was mean. Since the restuarant serves regular breakfast to "paying" customers they get the best treatment. Oh well. I would stay here again if we visit Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dgilley
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Great service and location. Turner's bar was excellent. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Did NOT meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: AES821
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Canterbury as a part of a family wedding party. We both really looked forward to staying at a hotel with such history and good reputation. I'm sad to say that we were disappointed from the moment we entered. No one offered to help us with our bags/luggage, so someone else in our party had to track down a luggage cart and helped us instead. When we arrived in our room, we were taken aback at how cramped and small the room was. We had multiple lights out in our room, then had to switch rooms because they couldn't get them working. The real disappointment was the staff. I ran into one young man late at night and asked where breakfast was served the next morning. He wasn't at the desk, but rather at the computer and could hardly be bothered by my question. He was rude and completely unprofessional. Additionally, we ordered room service late another night and were treated with rudeness as well. We were also continuously locked out of our room, as our key cards only worked randomly...this included the night of my brother's wedding when MANY of us, including the groom and his bride, were unable to get into our rooms. I'm honestly not picky when it comes to staying at hotels, except when I'm spending a good amount of money for a hotel that prides itself on impeccable customer service, as the Canterbury does. I really expected a higher level of hospitality and nicer/more updated accommodations, Things just seemed incredibly outdated and what I might expect from a 2 star motel. I probably will not be back nor pass along good reviews to others looking to visit the Indianapolis area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Close to Everything, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Steve_N_018
Reviews.Content: I am between 3 and 4 stars on this property. I had 14 people here for a trade show at the convention center, so for convenience this hotel gets a 5. All our employees were quite satisfied with the hotel. We had a 5 minute walk to our booth. We never walked more than 10 minutes to get to a good restaurant, they are all around. The rooms are a little dated, and could use a facelift, and none of us had business desks in our rooms, which makes it a little harder to work in the room after the show. The complimentary breakfast buffet was just eggs, sausage, bacon and some sort of potatoes, along with fruit and bread on a few days. The breakfast menu was much more complete. Service was fantastic and friendly, although it's odd they have no ice machines so I had to ask for ice to be brought up. Valet parking at $25/day is typical, although there are other garages nearby. So, if the rooms were a little newer and more business friendly, this would be a 4-star for sure. We will be back next year regardless.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but expected more”
Reviews.Author: apratt89
Reviews.Content: Considering the fact that I was in a penthouse suite I was slightly disappointed by what I got. The room seemed old (not in a good sense). The AC kind of sucked with the two level room, the second story was always stifling even with AC full blast and the bottom floor was too cold. Also, the lack of wastebins on the first floor was a hassle. The desk had several broken and/or missing pieces. The TV on the second floor (an old CRT) seemed out of place considering the flat pannel downstairs. Also, the complimentary breakfast sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Second time just as bad a first”
Reviews.Author: chipkandis
Reviews.Content: After our first visit a few years ago when everytime I used the hair dryer or curling iron we blew a fuse I swore I wouldn't go back. But we heard the new owner was putting some money into it we thought we would give it a try. Worst idea ever. First room we were in was 86 degrees. After having air on 3 hours only went to 78. They came and looked at it. By the time we got back from dinner 4 more hours it was only 77. So 9:30 they moved us to a smaller room that was 76 degrees. 11:00 called them up AGAIN. Looked at it and said ok is that better. If my husband wasn't feeling sick and asleep I would have left then. So the entire night it never got lower that 75 degrees. If I had paid $40 for a roach motel I might have expected no AC But when I spend $200 I would hope AC works. And if they put any money into the hotel I did not see it in either of the 2 room we were in. And the hallways were even hotter.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality without the lauxury price tag”
Reviews.Author: kiwijj
Reviews.Content: The Canterbury is in a top spot - right in the c entre of town and with an internal link to Circle Centre Mall. The hotel is beautifully restored, extremely comfortable, and well-run and includes free (pretty basic) breakfast. Only reservation would be the inadequate lighting and desk space for the business traveler - it's really difficult to work in the rooms. It would be good to have coffee-making facilities in the rooms. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great low key hotel in Indianaplois”
Reviews.Author: productionguru
Reviews.Content: Classy small hotel with a great staff and comfortable rooms. Room was clean and very quiet. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was adequate. Unfortunately, I did not have a chance to enjoy dinner, but menu looked interesting. Nice cozy hotel bar with decent cocktails. This place is within walking distance to all Indianapolis has to offer. Great city, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Classic Urban Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wblewis17
Reviews.Content: Great overnight stay in a classic style hotel last night. Please forward my thanks for a great stay to all. Service was over-the-top from Mike in the bar to Reggie who could not have been more helpful as well as the entire breakfast and front desk teams. I love the feel of the classic wood and rich furnishings. Best Wishes and I will stay there on my next visit to Indianapolis!

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets!!”
Reviews.Author: danchadlee75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our anniversary at the Canterbury and loved it. I've been in my share of hotels across the country due to business travel and was looking for something above and beyond the normal hotel experience. Don't get me wrong, I've stayed in some great hotels however the Canterbury was incredible and ranks among the best I've stayed in. The staff was great, rooms were clean, and our entire stay was extremely enjoyable. We'll definitely be back! Also, make sure to make dinner plans at Turner's, located just off of the hotel's lobby. The food was as good as anything we've had in Indianapolis, and the wait staff was incredibly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the value”
Reviews.Author: INMS
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Canterbury Hotel on Tuesday, June 21, 2011 and was surprised about the great customer service from the front door and desk service. The hotel is centrally locationed in the heart of the city within walking distance of the convention center. I ate in Turner's restuarant for breakfast and dinner and the food was good. I would suggest that the breakfast take notes from the Drury Inn. I had a room the had not been upgraded but was OK. I did get a chance to view one of the upgraded rooms with new bedding and the chance was nice. Overall the stay was great and I would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A definite gem in Indy!”
Reviews.Author: review37209
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff - super friendly! When there is so much else going on for this particular business meeting, I simply do not have to worry about where my group is staying. I know they will be in excellent hands and taken care of by the most accommodating staff. This is the only hotel I have selected for the last several years because it's a favorite of this group. Of course, and no doubt, the food is simply wonderful as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: AZRomandy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the Indy 500, the hotel is located downtown. It’s a small hotel and has a classical feel to it. The staff is super friendly and efficient. The rooms are ok, I stayed in a room on the third floor and it was a bit dark. They did tell me that the hotel had a new owner and he was investing money to renovate the hotel. The doors don't block out much noise, so you can hear what's going on in the corridors. The bar has a nice feel to it and looks out onto the street, the bar staff was very friendly and attentive. Breakfast was included in the rate, it was a buffet breakfast, scrambled eggs, bacon, muffins, coffee and juice. The selection was limited it would have been nice to see some fruit or veggies. The a la carte selection was pretty basic too. Great TV’s, free wifi was a bonus, they also had free bottled water and coffee in the mornings which was really handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old Fashioned Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marcelproustnyc
Reviews.Content: Chain hotels are not my thing, so I was delighted with my three night stay at the Canterbury. This is a classy, historic hotel, and a unique property. The owners are on site. The staff--many of whom have worked there for years--are great. There is a good restaurant (24 hour room service) and a clubby bar. The building is old, but I understand there is a renovation going on, and I did see two crews working while I was there. In a perfect world, I would have preferred more deluxe linens, and the decor and furnishings could use some sprucing up. But if you value old fashioned charm above modern sterility, then this is the place for you. And the piano player in the lobby was playing Beethoven as I checked in! PS There is no fitness center, but they will provide a day pass to a great gym nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, pleasant, comfortable, unique!”
Reviews.Author: old_box_player
Reviews.Content: This hotel (which recently changed hands) is in an historic building in the center of Indianapolis. Excellent restaurants are within easy walking distance, but the food in the hotel is every bit as good as what may be found elsewhere. The staff is attentive and professional without being overwhelming or condescending. The building itself has been sympathetically restored. Fresh flowers and comfortable furniture is in all of the public spaces. Rooms contain period art and furniture with unintrusive modern amenities -- mine had a 4 poster queen bed, comfortable chairs, a pull-out work desk under the tv (behind doors), a large armoire, three telephones, good wireless internet, and much more. I'm so glad I didn't stay at one of the nearby chains. Not only was this less expensive, but it was vastly better. To the reviewer who complained about the lack of ice machine: call room service. They bring it to you. I would never stay anywhere else while visiting Indianapolis. This is a treasure.

Reviews.Title: “What a terrible let down. Never stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Lealynn
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the comments about it being run down, and in dire need of updating. Our problem was that starting at 3am there was a steady stream of very loud "partygoers" going down our hall and screaming laughing etc. We called the front desk and the one man supposedly on security came up and told us that he had warned them and there was "nothing else he could do". Furious we pack our bags to head home, at 4 in the morning. We are then offered a better room because he didnt want to go and get our car. we later learned by staff in the restaurant that that night gentleman had let 35 people into the presidential suite and they were having a party. This was disgusting service and a real let down. this place is no long Indy fine hotel. It is attracting a much different crowd. STAY CLEAR

Reviews.Title: “Old does not have to mean falling apart”
Reviews.Author: eaglebrian
Reviews.Content: Wallpaper was pealing off the walls in the bathroom. The finish was worn off the bathroom fixtures. There were holes in hallway ceiling. Their website that my room had ppv movies and a mini bar, it had neither. There were only two hangers in the closet. The faucet leak a lot of water when I turned on the hot water. The queen room was small but the size was fine for just one person. The staff was friendly and the location was great. I used to work at a much older hotel in Chicago so I know that an old hotel does not have to mean old dilapidated rooms. There are much better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Eat at Turners, check out the lobby, but wait until rooms are dedone and staff gets retrained”
Reviews.Author: heritagephoto
Reviews.Content: We live downtown Indianapolis and decided to buy a Canterbury Groupon ($99) since this historic boutique hotel has a sterling reputation. Celebrating the completion of a work project and Valentine's Day, we checked in on a Friday afternoon. We were blown away by the beauty of the lobby and were warmly greeted. We quickly dropped off our suitcase and laptop computer, ran errands for 1/2 hour, then returned to check in. Our suitcase was immediately located, but our hearts sank as the bellhop said "You got the computer earlier, right?" We were obviously distressed as he checked the desk and several places before finally locating it five minutes later it in a storage closet. These things happen, but he offered no apology. We thought the elevators were fast (other reviewers complained about this). The standard queen room on the 9th floor was ok... but very small. We had been told that the new owner plans to update the rooms in a Ralph Lauren style, so we were not disappointed with the older wallpaper. The room was very clean, had easily accessible outlets by the bed for my laptop, and good reading lamps. Furniture was worn (one post on the 4-post bed had been glued on and was very rickety). We were most disappointed with the sheets which were rough (come on, since the rooms are outdated and dinky at least splurge on luxurious linens). I slept well, but the fan blew directly on my husband in bed and he was up several times trying to correct the setting. Overall, you only want a standard queen room if you plan to be out most of the time since this is not a comfortable, relaxing space (which was our goal). It's nice that there is an entrance to the City Centre Mall and the location to other restaurants couldn't be better. Turners Restaurant was the best part of our stay (both dinner and breakfast). Excellent food (worth the price) and extra friendly service. Although the Groupon web page says 10% discount on Turners, the Groupon print-out does not mention it. So we had to leave paying full price. I looked it up overnight and told the staff during check-out. It was quite a lengthy fuss (20 minutes or more) to get them to reimburse us and they seemed flummoxed and even suspicious that the last name on the restaurant credit card (my husband's) was different than my card which we used on the room. They finally reimbursed us, and we got a quick apology for the length of time it took, but we both left with the impression that reception staff do not like discounts and special deals and had not been told enough about the Groupon). The young staff needs to learn the value of a smile and a sincere apology. To seal the deal, we left our cell phone charger in an outlet. Several calls to housekeeping and a trip back downtown to look at cords, and no luck finding it, and again no apology. I had to suggest to the receptionist that she record my name and contact information in case they find it (I'm not holding my breath). We had such high expectations about the wonderful service that others had reported, but other than the great restaurant, waiters, and grand lobby we might as well have been at a Super 8 (they would have probably offered an in-room coffee maker, though). I'm not saying never go there and I'd love to see the newly decorated rooms (some model rooms have been done by different interior decorators), but it wasn't a great experience for us and we probably won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dj224
Reviews.Content: I was in Indianapolis on business and decided that based off of the look of the hotel I'd give it a shot. The lobby area is beautiful, the hotel restaurant has a very rich feel to it (food is above average in preparation and presentation) and is great for business lunch/dinner. Now, the elevators...I was on the 9th floor and walked down to my colleague's room on the 5th floor no less than 4 times due to delays. Now, the only reason I make note of this is that I had mentioned it to the staff and there was nothing more than a "we're sorry." Not that I'm looking for it, but most places that I stay would say, "let us upgrade you for the inconvenience," "what can we do for you," etc. I was just a bit disappointed, but this lead me to believe that it's a recurring event, and if they did that for everyone that had an issue, they'd be run ragged. The rooms and esp. bathrooms were clean, the staff was extremely friendly, and the locale was great. Now, would I stay there again?...you bet! If you can deal with the elevator issue, which in the grand scheme of things is not really a big deal) and are looking for a hotel with charm and personality in a great downtown setting, this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: frodo55Marion_IN
Reviews.Content: Checked into the hotel on January 6. According to the hotel's website and some reviews, the hotel is undergoing a must needed update. Unfortunately, I saw little evidence. At the registration, the two clerks were pleasant, but not efficient. After assigning me my room, I took the EXTREMELY SLOW elevator to the fourth floor. On entering the room, I thought I was outside, the room being very cold. I then turned on the heat. Interestingly, half the vent threw out cold air while the bottom half threw out warm air, leaving the room cold. I then called the desk and told them about the problem. To their credit, within five minutes someone was at my door to move me to a new room. I then was assigned a room on the 12th floor. It was a nice sized room, but once again the heating--although warm--was not easy to control. The room was clean with a comfortable bed. Unfortunately, it was right near the elevator whose door and sound awakened me very early in the morning. The television is out of the 1950s, very old with poor quality picture. Also, no coffee machine in the room, but there were bottles of water. A breakfast did accompany the room, but the breakfast room was being painted. Hence, breakfast was simple, but okay, and serviced in a room by the front desk. Actually, the coffee was good! Overall, I would rate the stay as average. I believe I paid a "special" rate of $139.00 the room. There are other hotels in the area that are less expensive and much better updated. To be fair, the staff was courtesy, helpful, and pleasant. The room, simply average and needs updating, greatly. If you have any difficulities with elevators, stay away from this hotel. Sometimes people have to wait ten minutes to get the elevator. Finally, some of my friends simply walked down the stairs from their room on the third floor with their luggage due to the slow elevator. To conclude, the room is average, the food okay, the people grand. If you have to stay here, no problem, but don't expect what you see on the hotel's website concerning the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: sapper26
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the hotel for one night recently. It is quite a beautiful little place, with friendly staff, and very nice accommodations. The hotel kindly gave us a military discount and a nice corner room, with a little couch and other chairs where we could visit with our friends who were in the area. The hotel is also connected to a mall, which is quite nice, especially during cold or rainy weather. I would highly recommend this hotel! It is a very nice place. The only thing to note is to expect to pay $20 for 12-24 hour parking in the parking garage next door as this is the only parking I am aware of.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific gem in Indy”
Reviews.Author: kdfrench
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific gem in the heart of Indy. Not only would I recommend the hotel to a friend, but I'd stay there again if I returned to the Indy. We were within walking distance to many restaurants, shopping, Conseco Arena and Lucas Oil Field. It was easy to access the hotel from the expressway and easy to get back to the expressway when necessary. I'd like to say that before booking here, I'd read a lot of mixed reviews on the property. I decided to book the room based on great reviews of the most important things to me- cleanliness and service. Many of the complaints were about the outdated decor of the rooms, which I think is really superficial. It's a historic Hotel, it'd seem wrong if everything was slick and modern. Yes, I felt kind of like I was visiting Grandma's house with the wallpaper & furnishings, but that's okay. I found it welcoming and comfortable. The "flaws" in my 8th floor room were so minor - I actually looked for them based on the reviews I'd read - I commend the staff for keeping the hotel in such great shape. There was a little tearing in the wallpaper next to the tub and the switchplates for the light switches had little scratches. The service was impeccable. When we arrived, Keith - the valet - introduced himself and parked the car. After that, whenever he saw us come and go, he greeted us by name! The rest of the staff that we had contact with was equally as friendly. Lastly, I want to comment on the restaurant/breakfast. Some of the reviews I read had negative comments on the breakfast. The complimentary breakfast is a nice buffet. They offer scrambled eggs, hash browns, sausage, bacon, some sort of danish/pastry, varied fruits and one day we also saw English muffins and bagels. You could also order from the menu, but that was not free. While some may feel this breakfast lacks in variety, the quality of the food was excellent - much better than mini boxes of cold cereal, or stale, pre-packaged pastries. The only think I felt would add would be the ablity to make your own waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap thus worth it”
Reviews.Author: kjve9876
Reviews.Content: We rented the Presidential Suite and while it was out dated it was also only $600 a night! The room service is outrageously priced, for dinner you can't order anything normal like a sandwich. Its all very pricy.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the thick of it!”
Reviews.Author: Boystowtraveler
Reviews.Content: Nice accommodations and a very good breakfast. We had a nice room, somewhat small and the hotel is very old, but what we had was very nice and reasonable. The AC was great and very quiet. Front desk was helpful and very pleasant. If you came to Indy without transportation, this would be a good choice since it is in the middle of the city and the bus lines are close.

Reviews.Title: “down and out in indiana”
Reviews.Author: rjmollot
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of independent hotels in downtown areas: some of them are neat and really pleasant places to stay, others not so much. The Canterbury falls into the latter category. The decor and furnishings are rather blah and cut rate and the room felt so old and used. There are a ton of hotels in the immediate vicinity that one can choose from, it seems like one can easily choose better than this one. The sheets were old and threadbare. The curtain had a cigarette burn in it, apparently from the days before the room was non-smoking. The bathroom was not dirty, just old and dismal. There are signs saying that the hotel is being renovated but frankly they should not wait another second to dispose of the bed linens and shower curtains. On the plus side the people who worked there were pleasant enough.

Reviews.Title: “A real "boo" tique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruppsrunt
Reviews.Content: Years ago I had always heard good things about the Canterbury hotel. The problem with the hotel today is that nothing has changed in over thirty years. Upon checking in we found the "upgraded" room to be small and dirty. There was a plastic bottle cap under the bed, there was no bed skirt, and the sheets were torn. The decor of the room was probably nice in the 1970's, but not now. After expressing our concerns to the front desk, we were given a larger room, but again the blanket had cigarette burns in it and the room was dowdy at best. Be aware if you stay overnight and anticipate taking advantage of the "free" buffet breakfast (which was fairly good), be an early riser. The free breakfast is only available from 7 to 9 a.m. Add these inconveniences to a high occupancy tax and $25 for overnight parking, and a hotel in the suburbs becomes a lot more attractive. Perhaps after they have finished "renovating" the hotel it will be more client friendly, but until then, they could at least give potential guests a "fair warning" of the accomodations and ofter a discount until the upgrades are completed.

Reviews.Title: “They are renovating so beware!”
Reviews.Author: texas1946
Reviews.Content: The Canterbury is a charming hotel and the staff is wonderful. The hotel has been purchased so they are renovating the entire hotel. I think some of the rooms may be finished with this process but ours was not. We were originally assigned a room on the 5th floor and it was so horrible that we requested another. They then assigned the same room on the 8th floor. It was a little better but not much. The bath tub tile was chipped, the furnishings old and outdated..it just seemed dirty and old.. Our room overlooked the top of another building and some garbage cans. I've stayed in nicer rooms in a budget motel and this is supposed to be a 4 star property. There was a wedding party staying there when we were there so there must be some nice rooms available...they just weren't available for us. I think it will be a wonerful property eventually so don't take it off of your list just insist that you have an updated room if you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want from a hotel?”
Reviews.Author: phiberoptik
Reviews.Content: Maybe we are easy to please but this hotel was everything I had expected and hoped for and more. The staff was friendly and big thanks to the bellman Brandon for letting us borrow his umbrella for the night. We stayed in room 801, a king suite and the only thing criticism I can really say about the entire stay was that, this suite happened to have the two elevators directly outside of the door and we heard them a couple times early in the morning. Otherwise, the room was immaculate, although there is a bit of dating of the wallpaper and furniture. We chalked it up as character and enjoyed it. If you are wanting jacuzzis and modern fixtures this might not be for you, but the charm and class of this hotel is every bit of four stars. The first floor is something out of a mansion and the photos on the website do not do it justice. There is no reason to not stay here. The location is right downtown, very accessible, and valet is quick and easy. Its RIGHT next door to St. Elmos, and very close to almost anything to would want. Plus you can get to the City Centre Mall without ever going outside!

Reviews.Title: “The Night Before My Wedding”
Reviews.Author: sjnwil2
Reviews.Content: Ooohhh my goodness.. I just loved my stay. The inside of this place is awsome to see.. if you enjoy crown molding, grand pianos, marble floors, mirrors, and lots and lots of windows, this is the place for you. the night before my wedding, the bridal party stayed here, check in was a hassle, we reserved our rooms on the internet 1 day inadvance, (we could have gone anywhere, but since the theme of my wedding was the royal princess, I wanted to start early, it just set the right theme) they did not have the reservations, it took 2 managers and a desk clerk to finally find our rooms, but once that was done, I cannot tell you enough, the room service was fast, the servers were nice. The room was very clean, everything was perfect. This is the place to go, if you want to go all out for yourself, or any special night event. Parking was either vallet or park at the mall lot across the street.. we chose vallet (of course). All in all, I will stay there again, we have since moved from Indianapolis, but I will always make my stay there at the Caterbuy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, prompt service and an awesome location. We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: BusterB2007
Reviews.Content: I must say that I read some pretty discouraging reviews about the hotel on the internet. I decided to stay here because I once ran into Michael Jordan at this hotel and figured it must be nice if he is staying there. We checked into our room with no problem but when we got to the room we found that it had not been cleaned. The clerk immediately upgraded us to an awesome suite and we had no problems from then on. We forgot a few things and had to call the front desk for them and they had them brought up immediately. Infact, my wife and I had a few drinks the night we were there and woke up at about 6am very thirsty, we called the front desk and they had a pitcher of ice water brought to our door about 3 minutes after hanging up the phone. My wife and I were in Indy for a basketball game. The location of the hotel was awesome because we walked to Conseco in about 5 minutes. There are plenty of places to eat and have a drink on the same block as the hotel. We found out that the hotel is under new ownership and a lot of things are being done to bring this property back up to the standard it held when NBA teams and rock stars stayed there during their visits to Indy. Overall we loved it, the staff was very friendly and we will definitely stay there when in Indianapolis, as long as the prices stay resonable because this property is on its way back to the top of the list as must stays.
